meanings.definition: To boast more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She kept outboasting her friends about her new bike.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outboast others in sports.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outboasting the birds about finding the biggest acorn.
meanings.sent4: The waves outboasting each other in a race to reach the shore first.
meanings.sent5: The sun outboasting the moon in brightness as it rose in the sky.

meanings.sent1: His outboasting made everyone tired of listening to him.
meanings.sent2: The outboasting at the party was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent3: The outboasting of the peacock made the other animals roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The outboasting of the wind drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The outboasting of the lion scared away all the other animals in the jungle.
